page.title: 08THOUGHTS OF BLACKO RESIDENT
page.content: A lovely June day, a heat haze along the Utherstone Valley which portends a good sunny day.{PENDLE HILL}says 'warm and dry.' The first cup of tea, the one that tastes best. I say my morning prayers as I dress,'Grant good Lord that I fall into no sin nor run into any kind of danger this day.' The daily newspaper and the milk have been delivered to my doorstep. There is talk of no milk delivery in the future - the newspaper contains no good news. I go to the village stores to collect my bread. Soon the village shops will be forced out of business, all these big superstores will overwhelm them and undercut them. The village will be the poorer, no village shop, no village news, no meeting place for housewives, no sweetshop for children to choose their favourite goodies... { Jane H. Walton, 234, Gisburn Road.
